thread.title: Diddy Gets 3rd Knee Surgery in a Year, Was Told He'd 'Never Run Again'
thread.title_full: Diddy Gets 3rd Knee Surgery in a Year, Was Told He'd 'Never Run Again'

author: Jackie Willis
title: Diddy Gets 3rd Knee Surgery in a Year, Was Told He'd 'Never Run Again'
text: Diddy Gets 3rd Knee Surgery in a Year, Was Told He'd 'Never Run Again' by Jackie Willis 4:55 AM PST, February 03, 2017 Photo: Instagram Can't nobody hold Diddy down! The hip-hop mogul, who also goes by Sean Combs, snapped photos from his hospital bed on Thursday night, revealing that he had undergone his third and final knee surgery in under a year. "They said I'd never run again," he shared in one of his Instagram captions. "Third time's a charm!!! #Rebirth, don't take the simple things in life for granted." WATCH: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Talks UCLA Incident -- You Have to 'Be There for Your Kids 110 Percent' Diddy's three daughters, D'Lila, Jessie and Chance, visited their dad in the hospital as well as two of his three sons. "I don't know what I would have done if I didn't have my sons by my side these last two years!" the 47-year-old musician captioned a photo of him and his boys. "They have been more than sons, they have been my support system. NOW LETS BALL #RealLove." Diddy also posed with a bouquet of flowers that he received from his "brother," rapper French Montana. "God puts us all thru things for reason. It's up to us to learn through the things that he puts us through!" he wrote. "Sometimes you have to go through the pain to get to the joy." MORE: Lena Dunham Gives Firsthand Account of What It's Like Living With Endometriosis and Being Hospitalized "SAVE ME A DANCE! All LOVE!!!!" he exclaimed. "I'M DOING GREAT BY THE WAY! Thank you." A photo posted by DIDDY (@diddy) on Feb 2, 2017 at 8:42pm PST A photo posted by DIDDY (@diddy) on Feb 2, 2017 at 8:34pm PST A photo posted by DIDDY (@diddy) on Feb 2, 2017 at 8:32pm PST A photo posted by DIDDY (@diddy) on Feb 2, 2017 at 8:29pm PST Diddy isn't the first to recently document his time in the hospital. Nick Cannon was hospitalized for complications with lupus in December and kept his fans in the loop about his recovery. Check out his hospital pics: RELATED SLIDESHOW
